problem_names:
lemma integral_sin_Z [simp]:
  assumes "n \<in> \<int>"
  shows "integral\<^sup>L (lebesgue_on {-pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. sin(x * n)) = 0"

lemma integral_sin_Z' [simp]:
  assumes "n \<in> \<int>"
  shows "integral\<^sup>L (lebesgue_on {-pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. sin(n * x)) = 0"

lemma integral_cos_Z [simp]:
  assumes "n \<in> \<int>"
  shows "integral\<^sup>L (lebesgue_on {-pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. cos(x * n)) = (if n = 0 then 2 * pi else 0)"

lemma integral_cos_Z' [simp]:
  assumes "n \<in> \<int>"
  shows "integral\<^sup>L (lebesgue_on {-pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. cos(n * x)) = (if n = 0 then 2 * pi else 0)"

lemma odd_even_cases [case_names 0 odd even]:
  assumes "P 0" and odd: "\<And>n. P(Suc (2 * n))" and even: "\<And>n. P(2 * n + 2)"
  shows "P n"
translations:
lemma integral_sin_Z [simp]:
  assumes "n \<in> \<int>"
  shows "integral\<^sup>L (lebesgue_on {-pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. sin(x * n)) = 0"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. LINT x|lebesgue_on {- pi..pi}. sin (x * n) = 0
proof (subst lebesgue_integral_eq_integral)

proof (state)
goal (3 subgoals):
 1. integrable (lebesgue_on {- pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. sin (x * n))
 2. {- pi..pi} \<in> sets lebesgue
 3. integral {- pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. sin (x * n)) = 0
show "integrable (lebesgue_on {-pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. sin (x * n))"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. integrable (lebesgue_on {- pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. sin (x * n))
by (intro continuous_imp_integrable_real continuous_intros)

proof (state)
this:
  integrable (lebesgue_on {- pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. sin (x * n))

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. {- pi..pi} \<in> sets lebesgue
 2. integral {- pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. sin (x * n)) = 0
show "integral {-pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. sin (x * n)) = 0"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. integral {- pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. sin (x * n)) = 0
using assms Ints_cases integral_sin_nx

proof (prove)
using this:
  n \<in> \<int>
  \<lbrakk>?q \<in> \<int>;
   \<And>z. ?q = of_int z \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis
  integral {- pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. sin (x * real_of_int ?n)) = 0

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. integral {- pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. sin (x * n)) = 0
by blast

proof (state)
this:
  integral {- pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. sin (x * n)) = 0

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. {- pi..pi} \<in> sets lebesgue
qed auto

lemma integral_sin_Z' [simp]:
  assumes "n \<in> \<int>"
  shows "integral\<^sup>L (lebesgue_on {-pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. sin(n * x)) = 0"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. LINT x|lebesgue_on {- pi..pi}. sin (n * x) = 0
by (metis assms integral_sin_Z mult_commute_abs)

lemma integral_cos_Z [simp]:
  assumes "n \<in> \<int>"
  shows "integral\<^sup>L (lebesgue_on {-pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. cos(x * n)) = (if n = 0 then 2 * pi else 0)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. LINT x|lebesgue_on {- pi..pi}. cos (x * n) =
    (if n = 0 then 2 * pi else 0)
proof (subst lebesgue_integral_eq_integral)

proof (state)
goal (3 subgoals):
 1. integrable (lebesgue_on {- pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. cos (x * n))
 2. {- pi..pi} \<in> sets lebesgue
 3. integral {- pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. cos (x * n)) =
    (if n = 0 then 2 * pi else 0)
show "integrable (lebesgue_on {-pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. cos (x * n))"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. integrable (lebesgue_on {- pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. cos (x * n))
by (intro continuous_imp_integrable_real continuous_intros)

proof (state)
this:
  integrable (lebesgue_on {- pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. cos (x * n))

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. {- pi..pi} \<in> sets lebesgue
 2. integral {- pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. cos (x * n)) =
    (if n = 0 then 2 * pi else 0)
show "integral {-pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. cos (x * n)) = (if n = 0 then 2 * pi else 0)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. integral {- pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. cos (x * n)) =
    (if n = 0 then 2 * pi else 0)
by (metis Ints_cases assms integral_cos_nx of_int_0_eq_iff)

proof (state)
this:
  integral {- pi..pi} (\<lambda>x. cos (x * n)) =
  (if n = 0 then 2 * pi else 0)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. {- pi..pi} \<in> sets lebesgue
qed auto

lemma integral_cos_Z' [simp]:
  assumes "n \<in> \<int>"
  shows "integral\<^sup>L (lebesgue_on {-pi..pi}) (\<lambda>x. cos(n * x)) = (if n = 0 then 2 * pi else 0)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. LINT x|lebesgue_on {- pi..pi}. cos (n * x) =
    (if n = 0 then 2 * pi else 0)
by (metis assms integral_cos_Z mult_commute_abs)

lemma odd_even_cases [case_names 0 odd even]:
  assumes "P 0" and odd: "\<And>n. P(Suc (2 * n))" and even: "\<And>n. P(2 * n + 2)"
  shows "P n"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P n
by (metis nat_induct2 One_nat_def Suc_1 add_Suc_right assms(1) dvdE even odd oddE)
end
